lexUnit.name: flex.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: contract a muscle (often in order to bend a joint)

sentence.text: One of Britain 's top bodybuilders is to flex his muscles at an event in Hartlepool 's Town Hall Theatre .
He put his pen down , flexed his fingers in a by now automatic reflex , dragged himself across to the window , looked out , and burst into tears .
He released her and sat back , flexing his legs in the confines of the car .
It was on the evening of the fourth day that she raised her wings and flexed them in the sea-wind .
Keith postured , flexing his biceps for Douglas to see .
He flexed his hands like a conjuror and dived into a lower drawer in his desk .
He flexed his toes on the carpet .
As you inhale , tighten them , curling your toes under then flexing them towards your body .
` Well , you 'll get your chance , I hope , " he said wryly , and tried to flex his arms .
She turned the pages briskly , paused , frowned , cleared her throat , flexed her eyelids , and leaned forward in cold concentration .
Carefully , he flexed his bent fingers .
Quinn flexed the fingers of his hand ; the stub of pencil fell to the floor .
Doyle twitched and flexed his fingers , trying to communicate to Bodie in the only way possible .
I flexed a toe .
As the slope steepens or becomes icier , it is necessary to flex the ankles and knees more , and turning the toes downwards from the direction of travel will help .
Then , flexing their powerfully muscled silver bodies , they thrash their tails and leap from the water .
He flexed his fingers to get the feeling back , and fumbled in his pocket for his keys .
Then he flexed his hand again , and the claws retracted with a flash of silver .
The male bicolour damselfish flexes the muscles attached to its swim bladder as it patrols its patch of coral reef .
Pushing back his chair , Rune rose to his feet , flexing his shoulder muscles before mounting the rostrum .
He played scales , flexing his surgeon-sculptor 's hands .
He flexed his toes again .
The muscles in his face had flexed tight as he spoke and his breathing had become uneven .
As her silence lengthened a muscle flexed in his jaw and she saw a flicker of murderous rage in his eye for one instant .
Cowley was unhappy with what Doyle proposed , and his craggy , northern features frowned and flexed with irritation as his operative spoke .

About four years after his accident , Guy learned to stand on his hemiplegic leg without his toes flexing automatically , so that he could hold his balance while he lifted his other leg off the floor .
He saw how Wolfe 's leg muscles flexed impotently as he tried to scrabble to his feet ; how he squirmed in the two men 's grip , trying to get away .
There was a dull pain in his lower jaw , from hours of teeth-clenching , and the fingers of his right hand flexed and unflexed spasmodically , like those of an elderly arthritic .
He felt his fingers flexing , and he balled his hands into fists and jammed them into his pockets .
His body flexed as he hauled the heavy bike up on to the centre stand , and her heart jerked and accelerated to a steady two hundred beats a minute .
